title: Customer Service Manager Job at Outsource Nigeria
content:
Outsource Nigeria is a full-service Human Resources agency, specializing in providing outsourced turnkey manpower solutions to growing companies. Our solution include HR Services, Recruiting, Accounting, IT Support, Business Intelligence, Developers, and Operations including management and field / phone / automated based resources. The core of Outsource Nigeria’s success is its people.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Manager
Job Location: Head Office or Regional Office - Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Head of Operations / Director of Client Services

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Customer Service Manager leads the customer service team to deliver prompt, professional, and effective support to clients and partners.
	This includes overseeing customer touchpoints across channels and resolving escalated complaints.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage a team of customer service officers, ensuring KPIs are met.
	Develop and enforce service standards, response time protocols, and escalation processes.
	Handle complex customer complaints and ensure resolution within SLA.
	Recruit, train, and supervise customer service staff and corpers.
	Prepare detailed reports on customer queries, complaints, and service trends.
	Liaise with operations, technical, and finance departments to resolve systemic issues.
	Monitor customer satisfaction through surveys, feedback tools, and analytics.
	Recommend improvements to systems and processes to enhance the customer experience.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Communication, or related field.
	5–7 years of experience in customer service roles; 2+ years in a managerial capacity.
	Strong problem-solving, people management, and communication skills.
	Familiarity with CRM platforms, helpdesk tools, and customer analytics.


Salary Budge
N200,000 Monthly + PFA + HMO.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@outsourcenigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Tax and Compliance Lead Job at Seven-Up Bottling Company Limited
content:
Seven-Up Bottling Company Ltd is one of the largest manufacturing companies in Nigeria, producing and distributing some of the nation’s most- loved beverages in the country like; Pepsi, 7Up, Mirinda, Teem, Mountain Dew, H2oH!, Lipton Ice Tea and Aquafina premium drinking water. SBC has recently entered into Home & Personal Care category with the 2SURE brand and launched its first product, a Hand & Surface Sanitizer. Seven Up boasts of nine bottling plants with state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities strategically located across various regions in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax and Compliance Lead
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Brief


	We are hiring for an experienced Tax and Compliance Lead who'll oversee all tax-related activities within the company, ensuring compliance with tax laws and regulations, timely remittances, accurate financial reporting, and proactive management of tax risks.


Responsibilities


	Manage all tax compliance aspects, including income tax, VAT, and withholding taxes (State and Federal), ensuring accurate and timely remittances before due dates.
	Coordinate with external auditors during tax audits, meeting audit requirements, and implementing recommendations to enhance internal controls.
	Facilitate the process and obtain a Certificate of Fixed Asset Addition (CAFA)
	Handle VAT remittances for foreign transactions and other income, ensuring compliance with tax laws and regulations.
	Stay updated on changes in tax laws and regulations, communicating relevant updates to the finance team and ensuring full compliance.
	Compute and review Company income taxes and non-company income taxes, filing them as due.
	Monitor tax notices and audits across all regions, ensuring timely resolution and compliance.
	Ensure appropriate WHT deduction/provision on logistic services monthly, complying with regulatory requirements.
	Update and track excise duty remittances, ensuring timely submission and compliance.
	Prepare and share inventory disposal letters as needed, adhering to tax regulations and internal policies.
	Oversee annual tax and transfer pricing audits, implementing necessary changes and improvements.
	Conduct quarterly compliance audits and ensure ERP setup complies with tax regulations.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND
	5 years+ experience in a tax lead role
	ACCA/ACA/CITN professional certification
	Experience in the FMCG sector.

title: Bank Reconciliation Officer Job at LemFi (YC S21)
content:
LemFi (YC S21) is building the neobank for African diaspora in North America & Europe. We provide our users with a multi-currency account that allows them to hold, send, and receive money from Africa in any currency for their business and personal banking needs. We are a fast-paced startup with entities in the UK, USA, Canada and Nigeria and you would be required to familiarize yourself with necessary statutory and regulatory requirements in these locations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bank Reconciliation Officer

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full time

About The Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	You are a candidate who would thrive in a fintech startup environment like ours, where we readily accept individuals with a humble, yet uplifting attitude alongside a diligent sense of work ethic.
	The teams here at Lemonade Finance are passionate about their work and fields of expertise, but also lend hands on cross-functional responsibilities to ensure the success of the company and the satisfaction of our clientele.


What You’ll Be Doing


	The role of the Bank Reconciliation Officer, Nigeria, is a fully remote position within LemFi’s Finance team.
	In this role, you should have a demonstrated knowledge of Accounting and IFRS best practices with, at minimum, 2 years relevant experience in the finance industry.


Responsibilities Are As Follows


	Ensure daily reconciliation of all bank accounts within the company.
	Ensure daily reconciliation of inter account fund movements within the company.
	Ensure all GL entries are backed up with documentation and approvals.
	Work closely with the Finance and Reconciliation team to ensure prompt resolution of all outstanding items.
	Ensure prompt posting of all bank related transactions.
	Sending periodic summary statements of accounts movements to the Financial Accountant
	Engage in cross-functional responsibilities and assist the Financial Controller where needed.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in finance, Accounting, or any related discipline.
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in an accounting role at a FinTech or financial institution.
	Professional certification such as ACCA, ICAN or relevant qualification will be an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of IFRS
	Understanding of the local and global financial services industry.
	Excellent mathematical and statistical skills.


Salary
N6,000,000 - N7,200,000 / Annum.
